moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4: it all starts with this: mainly preparing Nf3, and supporting an eventual e4-e5; we ingnore c5 as a whole...
moves.2... d6: only justifiable after Nc3: Nc6 is the best move; contest d2-d4...
moves.4. c3: mainly against Nb8-c6-b4/d4: which is not happening at all...
moves.4... d5: normally, d5 is a winning move in the Sicilian: not here...
moves.5. e5 c4 6. d4: no second thoughts: cxd3ep is not good...
moves.6... Nc6 7. Be3: an important move, in the GPA: this keeps the White King out of checks, after castling...
moves.8... f6 9. Bg2 Qb6 10. Qc2: also part of the GPA: covering for b2; in some cases - against a strong Sicilian - this could lead to check on g1: but certainly not here...
moves.11... Bd7 12. O-O Rc8: castling long, might have been an option: I don't know...
moves.13. Nbd2: finishing development, and the full GPA setup: now let's play chess...
moves.14. cxb4 c3: this too: Bxb4, would have been more convincing...
moves.15. Nb3: I fail to see Blacks' point...
moves.16. Qxb2 fxe5: of course, pawn b4 is poisonous: but this is not much better...
moves.18... Rd8 19. g4: nothing special: just avoiding Blacks' last free move Nf5; however, Black resigned...

gameName: fiercequeen, demonstrating the Grand Prix Attack...
